description: Flexible, fast, robust, stable, lots of features, frequently updated, rock solid and really cool. I've been using it since version 2.42, back when I abandoned 3DS max

3D isn't really my forte. I simply wanted to put a floor plan for a building. I tried a few easy 3D programs. I tried to import models but wasn't rewarding. I stumbled on Blender while looking for models to import. It had everything - plus the steep learning curve. It was worth the effort. I now have my 3D building with sofas, automatic sliding glass doors, awesome lights and a fly-through camera. Wohhhaa!!
It does have a documentation at https://docs.blender.org/
Well It as good as you think
Super Amzing
i like the sculpting tool!!

This software is the real deal, the best of FOSS and rightfully growing in popularity and use among the widest community for 3D which includes film, tv, concept artists, it is massive and deservedly so, they just got new patreons in UNITY, they are also getting grants From EPIC and funded by the blender community, as well as big names NVIDIA, AMD, INTEL, among them, sometimes through continued financial support others through developers and assistance. Blender is a 2D Grease pencil/2.5D/3D/XR supported(view so far) software used by so many people 2.83 is the Long Term Support version, they also have daily builds and experimental versions. it is free forever and requires zero sign in to download and use.
summary: Blender is community, the community is Blender

description: nice this is so cool

I've been using blender for years now. Long enough to remember when cycles wasn't there and yafaray was "unlimited power"
Blender has a huge issue his eternal love for Nvdia. As an AMD GPU user, I prefer to use Lux Render ratter than cycles, because right now, we are still "discussing" how to avoid crashes with volumes with any polaris card (and some others too) if you are an AMD user you'll face a lot of issues. As for OpenCL it will work even on "non supported" distros like Fedora so is useless to blame OpenCL (Mac users must be extremely happy...) while you support every Nvidia "feature" that sums USD 1000 to their madness and basically, you ignore AMD users no matter what system they are using. Right now, EEVEE is a ground braking innovation (specially for film and VFX) and it will run perfectly fine on the open source AMD driver using openGL. As for cycles, DITCH IT. if you have an AMD GPU you might want to avoid a stroke and use Lux Render instead. Works flawlessly using the propietary openCL part of AMD's driver.
This software is amazing, It can do anything from modeling to sculpting and even 2d hand-drawn animations. Blender is very stable at rarely crashes.

Blender is a great 3D, 2D creation suite. There is even a Netflix series mainly created with it. The version provided via fedoraproject.org does not support OptiX - use snap instead.

description: Great app, updated frequently, its an open source classic.

A fun program for me to play around with. I'm a noobie idiot and even I can get some use out of it. Chris Barnatt of Explaining Computers.com is a big fan of Blender. He uses it but also uses it as a test program for SBCs.

Be aware. Since 2.8x blender is a bug nest and the developers seems to be focused on Nvidia users only. If you plan to use your GPU with this soft, and you have an AMD card, You'll probably preffer to deal with autodesk and maya. It can be frustrating, and they really go forward in the wrong way withg RTX only leaving OpenCL aside. It has a lot of free promotion, it's open source, and that is a reason why to fork it. Someone should do it. because right now they have as many experimental branches as a 100.000 years old tree but 2.92 should be codenamed "Nvidia in extremis"

description: Tried flatpak and building this on fedora 38 and it just does not work. shame because it used to be faultless.
bro all of you rating it horribly are wrong, this thing runs great on chromebook
The Biz! Best 3D creation software ever.

To those who rate this 4 or lower. You simple don’t know the power of the software. I am here to educate you.

Pare this with Krita, Inkscape and font forge and you have an elite and dead simple combination studio Art sollution. Just a couple of other tools like Gimp, hand-break, a few other nice paid ones; plus some proprietary stuff like Adobe via Wine to ensure clients can send and recieve PSDs, PSBs, AI and AE files. Add a couple addons... Done. That's all a professional artist could ever need. Really.

There is nothing better than THIS TOOL for a generalist or even a beginner 3D artists; THIS is the pinnacle of art ONE PERSON STUDIO tools, at least in every available Linux software repo. This tool is the sun to the universe of art tools.
So don't forget that you're rating the best of the best.

What do I know about 3D art software?

It's SOOO much better for generalists like me who one one UI and control scheme to do everything. And if you must work closer and faster with producers to iterate; blender’s eevee render pipeline is a life-line we desperately needed. 

This tool got me through 5 years in corporate where asking for software licenses was hard that we resorted to OpenSource, but we had to know how to do EVERYTHING in VFX and video game production.

This is the single greatest art package that has EVER come from Linux. 

My journey goes way back to using 3ds max when I was 12, till I got my BA degree at Qantm SAE for Animation and Games. Got my first art job just as I turned 18 in mobile games development where I dropped Maya, picking up Modo. I went freelance for a while, working for various different clients to make games ads and VFX. Then I was hired at a slot machine company In 2018; where I transitioned in Blender when 2.8 rolled out; and proceeded to to make the most amazing, mouthwatering art I’d ever made; doing things I never thought were possible. Using this free and open source tool; we raised the standard of the art we make in that studio and that has caused many others in the organisation to switch to Blender.

Here's some of my work:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1EBCEjOA1htZTMjyIJ6BJToyvGUQgA4SZ

Especially look at the Jaguar and red ring… see the tasty gold shading? The pixel filtering? ALL of it is done in BLENDER. JUST BLENDER. Not AE, not NUKE, Maya, substance, zbrush or anything else. All this is done in Blender within a couple of days of effort. One Ctrl-f12 button; render and post to all output locations.

I made a FORTUNE using Blender for this reason.

As of writing this; after 5 years of my last job using Blender, I'm back in freelancing, and so glad I still have an entire art studio worth of software I can whip out at any time on any machine and get amazing work done.

And yes, you can hire me to help you with Blender on your project:

You can contact me here:

simon.p.heggie@gmail.com
I know this application since 5 years. The quality of life improvements that have been added/introduced through updates last year are truly amazing.
summary: Good 2D/3D Applicaion for artists who value money, privacy and power
